content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of the wrap_string function:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input_str)
    result = IOBuffer()
    
    current_line_length = 0

    for word in words
        word_length = length(word) + 1 # Add 1 because of the space
        
        if current_line_length + word_length > text_width
            write(result, "\n")
            current_line_length = 0
        else
            if !isempty(read(result, String)) && read(result, Char) != '\n'
                write(result, " ")
                current_line_length += 1
            end
        end
        
        write(result, word)
        current_line_length += word_length
    end
    
    return String(take!(result))
end
```

Example:

```julia
input_str = "This is a simple example of how the wrap string function works."
println(wrap_string(input_str, 10))
```

